meanings.definition: Having or resembling small leaflets arranged on each side of a common stalk.
meanings.sent1: The fern had pinnulate leaves with tiny leaflets on each side.
meanings.sent2: The plant's pinnulate structure made it look delicate and intricate.
meanings.sent3: The pinnulate leaves danced in the breeze, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed like pinnulate wings, light and airy.
meanings.sent5: The pinnulate design of the artwork added a unique charm to the room.

meanings.sent1: The compound leaf was pinnulate, with distinct divisions along the main vein.
meanings.sent2: The tree's pinnulate leaves provided shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent3: The pinnulate pattern on the carpet gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back, pinnulate strands flowing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The artist meticulously painted the pinnulate details of the flower petals.
